paragraphs.text: Here is your excuse to be bored!
paragraphs.name: 08e6

paragraphs.text: A couple of weeks back I deleted several apps from my phone: Twitter, Instagram, Gmail, Facebook, among others, in an attempt to force myself to be bored. I’m trying to let go of the things that I would usually use to ‘fill the space.’ I want to learn to be okay with just being.
paragraphs.name: c41c

paragraphs.text: Try to just stand there and let yourself be bored
paragraphs.name: 4e42

paragraphs.text: Because distractions are a crutch, a mental habit, a refuge for the mind. They help us hide from difficult emotions, the present moment, and the fear of not being busy.
paragraphs.name: d460

paragraphs.text: A couple of weeks back I deleted several apps from my phone: Twitter, Instagram, Gmail, Facebook, among others, in an attempt to force myself to be bored. I’m trying to let go of the things that I would usually use to ‘fill the space.’ I want to learn to be okay with just being.
paragraphs.name: c41c

paragraphs.text: Are you ready to wake up, get more focused, and find more happiness in your life?
paragraphs.name: f0ac

paragraphs.text: Glad to hear that!

a60387a34c96.title: It is very hard and like all skills it requires practice.

paragraphs.text: It is very hard and like all skills it requires practice. But once you cultivate the silence you start to hear YOUR voice and that is the most precious thing in the world.
paragraphs.name: c3aa

paragraphs.text: I did too ! It’s amazing how much more i have accomplished. I finally got back to reading and writing. I love being bored now. The FOMO is most definitely gone too
paragraphs.name: ff0b

paragraphs.text: I would add: do not cross the street when the light is red and use these few seconds to enjoy boredom right in the crowd of people rushing from point A to point B
paragraphs.name: de8b

paragraphs.text: Chaotic surroundings = need to escape
paragraphs.name: 83cb

paragraphs.text: I recently quit a life long (25+ years) addiction to opiates. No one else is living on my sober plane — no one that I live with, that is. Except my grandchildren. I spend as much time with them as I can, but my phone (4 months new) is adult stimulation. My therapist has talked about…

e82764d7694f.title: I think once we become more aware of our responses to not having something to do immediately, we…

paragraphs.text: I think once we become more aware of our responses to not having something to do immediately, we begin to choose differently. For example, if we consciously do not grab for our phone or some other screen, we might open up another part of our brain that is more conscious of our thoughts…versus doing things habitually.
paragraphs.name: 243a

content.subtitle: When we get used to it, the bored feeling becomes a feeling of necessity since this is the time our greatest work is happening.

virtuals.subtitle: When we get used to it, the bored feeling becomes a feeling of necessity since this is the time our greatest work is happening.

paragraphs.text: Definitely. Finding silence is vastly important if we are to ever doing anything powerful with our life.

content.metaDescription: Today, in our cult of productivity, boredom is often viewed as utterly inexcusable — a sin — only committed by the lazy or unsuccessful. Yet it is a vital emotion that helps you cultivate creativity…
